message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
I need to respond to all 10 statements about AI in education from the perspective of a Norwegian primary or secondary school teacher. Let me think through each statement and provide thoughtful responses:

[TT4G35A]: AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans - This is generally true. AI tools can help generate ideas and improve lesson plans. I'd say "Agree" to this.

[TT4G35B]: AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities - This is a positive use case. AI can help personalize learning. I'd say "Agree".

[TT4G35C]: AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - This is also a positive application. I'd say "Agree".

[TT4G35D]: AI supports students with specific needs - This is true, AI can help with accessibility and personalization for students with different needs. I'd say "Agree".

[TT4G35E]: AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - Definitely true. This is a clear benefit. I'd say "Strongly agree".

[TT4G35F]: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - This is a real concern/risk. I'd say "Agree" to this risk.

[TT4G35G]: AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - This is a valid concern. AI can make mistakes or inappropriate suggestions. I'd say "Agree".

[TT4G35H]: AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions - This is a known issue with AI systems. I'd say "Agree".

[TT4G35I]: AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data - This is a valid concern with data handling. I'd say "Agree".

[TT4G35J]: AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches - This is possible depending on the AI system and context. I'd say "Agree".

Let me provide balanced responses as a teacher who sees both benefits and risks of AI in education.
